titles: Thirtene most plesant and delectable questions, entituled a disport of diuers noble personages written in Italian by M. Iohn Bocace, Florentine and poet laureate, in his booke named Philocopo. Englished by H.G. These bookes are to be solde at the corner shoppe, at the northweast dore of Paules
author: Boccaccio, Giovanni, 1313-1375.
Gifford, Humphrey.
Grantham, Henry, fl. 1571-1587.
publisher: By Henry Bynneman, for Rycharde Smyth,
notes: H.G. = Humphrey Gifford or Henry Grantham.
Reproduction of the original in the Bodleian Library.
keywords: Italian literature --  Translations into English --  Early works to 1800.
